column1: Art Institute of Chicago////Some of it is instantly recognizable: Wood's "American Gothic
column2: Seurat's Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
column5: etc.  It's wonderful to see those things up close.  But it's even more wonderful to discover works of art you've never seen before, and believe me, the Art Institute has loads of stuff you've never seen.  I've been countless times, and I'm still not sure I've seen everything.
